name: Premier Inn Blackpool Airport

reviews.text: great value, spotless clean rooms, ample parking very professional staff, very quiet to a great nights sleep, wacky warehouse next door to keep kids happy to few mins walk to prom to catch tram ideal if want hotel just outside from hustle and bustle
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: Staff friendly and welcoming. Food at the pub next door was average but acceptable. Biggest gripe was the room temperature. There were heating controls but no cooling. The requested temperature on the control panel was 18 degrees but the actual indicated temperature when we left was 28 degrees. My wife, children and me all had a very poor nights sleep because of the heat.
reviews.title: Hot hot hot.

reviews.text: We arrived very late to this hotel and was greeted by a very friendly reception man. Happy to help with a smile even at midnight! Nicley located just up the road from the Blackpool pleasure beach, just a short 5 minute walk to the trams.
reviews.title: Mini Break to Blackpool with Family

reviews.text: Rooms as always were clean and tidy and we were supplied with a fan and warned that the rooms may be a little warm, which they were indeed. The second day we spoke to the reception about the heat and they even gave us their air condition unit from behind their desks! This was much appreciated as it was very hot even for the children.
reviews.title: very dissapointing

reviews.text: The room had all the extras, TV, hair dryer, kettle etc.
reviews.title: Disappointed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this Premier Inn for its location to Blackpool Prom and were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Cycle the Promenade!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the hotel, cyclists are allowed to use the pavement, over the railway bridge and there in front of us was the southern end of miles of beautifully upgraded promenade. Turn left and you have more cycleway to Lytham St. Annes. Mile after mile of flat cycle route!
reviews.title: Needs Air CON in Bedrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Blackpool's new trams also start their run from this same place; around 400 yards from the hotel.
reviews.title: Another Excellent Premier Inn

reviews.text: The hotel staff extend a warm welcome. The room was warm, pleasant and very clean.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: Our 'best bit' was the no-hassle use of car park for the duration of our stay.
reviews.title: Hotel that ticked all the boxes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: comfortable hotel great room fantastic food friendly staff close to airport perfect for a shot break in blackpool
reviews.title: great night

reviews.text: large rooms staff very helpful comfortable bed lots of great channels on lcd tv
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

reviews.text: maid every day
reviews.title: 100% Comfort

reviews.text: Stayed one night with family of four(two teens, 13 years) Room very clean and beds comfortable and pillows were amazing - Great sleep. Check in quick and easy and we only used the restaurant next door to eat breakfast. After having had breakfast in the Premier Inn, Chester for two days, I was really disappointed with the breakfast there. We has breakfast at 10am and service was until 10.30am. There was no bread, the coffee was stewed and cold, no orange juice without bits for the kids and we had to ask for salt, etc. The staff were nice enough and did replenish these items for us. The actual cooked breakfast was fantastic and cooked very well. At Chester we were allowed to use the coffee machine but here the coffee was pre-made and tasted awful. My last stay here the coffee was awful too. Maybe if we had our breakfast earlier stocks would have been fuller but if service is until 10.30am then stocks should be replenished until then. Overall we had a comfortable stay here.
reviews.title: Nice but shame about the heat and noise

reviews.text: Returned here after a great stay last year. Again quiet comfy and relaxing, its minutes from pleasure beach but far enough away not to be affected from the noise. Airport creates no noise that would disturb you. Staff are excellent and great at their jobs. I will be back.
reviews.title: For Convenience Only

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for a two night break, August Bank Holiday (Sunday & Monday) for a bargain price of £25.00 per room per night. The room was spotless, lovely comfy bed, nice decor, and had flat screen TV, kettle etc and also shampoo and haidryer. Staff very polite. For the price it was really good value. There was also free car parking. Didnt eat at the next door facilities as we like to go out. It is well positioned for Blackpool and St Annes. You could hear children playing at the next door pub play area and you could hear people walking down corridors and children making noises inside the hotel but it didnt really disturb you; I think it is just worth mentioning so you are aware. We were at the front of the hotel and our friends were at the back of the hotel. They could hear some noise from the airport but they said it was nothing too bad and was infrequent. It was hot during our stay and fans were provided. Our room was sheltered and didnt get the sun as much as the back rooms so thats worth noting. I would stay here again for a short break.
reviews.title: Great Break

reviews.text: Stayed here last night, hotel its self was a bargain at £25 (booked it months ago) and wasn't bad apart from the road noise. So hot we needed to keep the window open all night so no escape from the road noise, wasn't too bad apart from some crazy idiots with really loud cars bombing around well after midnight. Other issue was noise was from people leaving their rooms and making a noise in the corridor, could clearly hear one guy leave his room just before 6am walk along the corridor down the stairs (even though they were miles away) get in his van start the engine and leave it running for about 5 minuets, nice.
reviews.title: Bir noisy from the road

reviews.text: Hotel was clean and the staff were very polite and helpful. Lots of free parking (rare in Blackpool) bus stop just down the road although its cheaper to park in the centre than 3 people get the bus (crazy but true).
reviews.title: Great Location for me.
Lovely hotel but don't book breakfast
reviews.text: If you get the chance get a room on the airport side (not very often you hear someone say that)

I have stayed here before when visiting family who live close by. Just a short walk from the airport and close to the pleasure beach and bus routes. The hotel is spotless and the rooms are very spacious. The beds and pillows are first class and I always have a great sleep. Bathrooms are big and have shower and hand soaps. Tea/coffee making facilities too. The Pub next door the Airballoon has a good choice of food and at a great price too. We always eat here at least once as the staff are very welcoming and the service is good. But it does get very busy with locals and at certian times you will have to wait for your food. I invited the family to join me for breakfast on my last morning and unfortunately this was not as good as Dinner. Plenty of choice and the food is good. But the self service table is not maintain by the staff as good as it should be. I had to ask serveral times for things. Cups, Glasses, Tea bags etc. Also the main hot breakfact was served before we finishes our starters. But over all the staff are good and it is good value for money. Would go back again for sure.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

description: Blackpool Airport is based at the international gateway to Blackpool. All of our rooms are fully equipped with everything a family will need to have a fantastic stay. Blackpool Pleasure beach is under 2 miles away. The adjacent 2for1 restaurant, The Air Balloon, offers great pub food and a children’s Wacky Warehouse. So why not sit in the sunshine for lunch and catch a few rays on the nearby beach.
